SEARCH
Module io.jstach.rainbowgum
Package io.jstach.rainbowgum

Interface LogEncoder

All Known Implementing Classes:
GelfEncoder, LogEncoder.AbstractEncoder
public interface LogEncoder
Encodes a LogEvent into a buffer of its choosing. While the LogEncoder.Buffer does not need to be thread-safe the encoder itself should be.

An appender typically calls an encoder by first creating a buffer that the encoder knows about or reusing an existing LogEncoder.Buffer the encoder knows about.

The encoding into a buffer typically happens outside of lock to minimize lock contention. Thus the appender promises not to share a buffer at the same time with other threads as well as only use a buffer the log encoder created at some point.

Once encoding is done the appender than typically enters into a lock (appenders attached to an async publisher may not need to use a lock) where the appender will ask the buffer to drain its contents into the output.

Because LogEncoder.Buffer is not a specific implementation the Encoder typically casts the buffer to the expected concrete implementation. LogEncoder.AbstractEncoder can make this logic easier and is recommended to extend it.

Given the complexity of encoders it is recommend use the much easier to implement interface of LogFormatter and convert it to an encoder with of(LogFormatter).

See Also:
  • LogFormatter
  • LogEncoder.Buffer
  • LogAppender
  • LogEncoder.Buffer.StringBuilderBuffer

  • Method Details

    • buffer

      LogEncoder.Buffer buffer(LogEncoder.BufferHints hints)
      Creates a new buffer. The encoder should not try to reuse buffers as that is the responsibility of the appender (and possibly LogOutput but usually not). Hints can be retrieved by call LogOutput.bufferHints().
      Parameters:
      hints - hints are like size and storage type etc.
      Returns:
      a new buffer.
      API Note
      hints can be retrieved by calling LogOutput.bufferHints() the reason the output itself is not passed is to prevent the buffer from using the output directly at an inappropriate time as well as the rare possibility of the buffer being used by multiple outputs.

    • encode

      void encode(LogEvent event, LogEncoder.Buffer buffer)
      Encodes an event to the buffer. It is recommended that the encoder call LogEncoder.Buffer.clear() before using.
      Parameters:
      event - log event.
      buffer - buffer created from buffer(BufferHints).

    • of

      static LogEncoder of(LogFormatter formatter)
      Creates an encoder from a formatter.
      Parameters:
      formatter - formatter.
      Returns:
      encoder.

    • of

      static LogConfig.Provider<LogEncoder> of(URI uri)
      Provides a lazy loaded encoder from a URI.
      Parameters:
      uri - uri.
      Returns:
      provider of encoder.
